bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of ding chuang 疔瘡 , pin-illness sores, with the sores being numb without pain, and assuming a yellow-black color. Ren zhai zhi zhi fang 仁齋直指方 22: 此疾雖自風毒而來，其 諸觸犯不可不信。如石疔之忌，瓦礫磚石；麻子疔之忌，麻衣麻仁；火 疔之忌，火光炙煿；水疔之忌，飲水渡河 , “This ailment is caused by wind poison. Nevertheless, there are all types of contact offenses that must be taken into regard. Such as [patients with] stone pin-illness, they must not come into contact with broken tiles, bricks or stones. [Patients with] hemp-seed pin-illness, they must not come into contact with garments made from hemp or hemp seeds. [Patients with] fire pin-illness, they must not come into contact with the light of fire and roasting and frying. [Patients with] water pin-illness , they must not drink water or wade through a river”.
